H0.text: It will float when the buoyant force is greater than the force of gravity acting on a ship.

H1.text: It will sink if the buoyant force is greater than the force of gravity acting on a ship.

H2.text: It will bobble if the buoyant force is greater than the force of gravity acting on a ship.

H3.text: It will explode if the buoyant force is greater than the force of gravity acting on a ship.

A4.text: If the buoyancy forces exceed the weight, the object is positively buoyant, and will tend to float upwards in the fluid.
